name: Chocolate Topped Crunchies
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees Celsius).
In a bowl, combine brown sugar, corn syrup, 2 tablespoons of peanut butter, and vanilla extract. Mix well.
Add cereal to the bowl and mix well to coat.
Press the mixture into a greased 8-inch baking pan.
Bake for 5 minutes.
Let the cereal mixture cool completely.
In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate and remaining peanut butter together on medium power for 3-4 minutes, stirring every minute until smooth.
Spread the melted chocolate mixture evenly over the cooled cereal layer.
Refrigerate the bars until the chocolate is set.
Cut the bars into desired sizes and store them in the refrigerator.

name: Cheerio Squares
instructions: Boil margarine, brown sugar, and corn syrup for 1 min.
Add vanilla extract and peanut butter to to the mixture. Then beat the mixture with a spoon until blended.
Add cheerios, corn flakes, and peanuts to the mixture.
Press the mixture into a 9x13 pan.

name: Apple Pie
instructions: Mix Crisco, boiling water, flour, baking powder, and salt (amounts not specified in the image) together.
Cover the pie shell with apples.
Sprinkle cinnamon sugar over the apples (amount not specified in the image).
Prick the top pastry with a fork.
Bake at 425°F for approximately 10 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350°F and bake for an additional 30 minutes.

name: Harvard Sauce (for beets)
instructions: Stir sugar and cornstarch together while cooking (until it becomes clear).
Add vinegar to the mixture.
Add some butter (amount not specified in the image).
Add beets to the sauce. Serve warm.

name: Mary's Dip
ingredients: 1 large package Knorr's Vegetable soup mix
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Cave out top of round pumpernickel bread.
Serve dip inside the hollowed-out bread.

name: Darden Fresh New Potato & Bean Salad
ingredients: 1.5 lb green and/or yellow beans, blanched
instructions: Cook mini red potatoes until tender.
Blanch green and/or yellow beans.
Combine cooked potatoes, blanched beans, chopped celery, chopped red pepper, and chopped dill weed in a bowl.
Mix in Miracle Whip dressing.

name: Betty Boob's Salad
instructions: Ingredients list does not provide instructions. No instructions found in the image.

name: Chocolate Topped Crunchies
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees Celsius).
In a bowl, combine brown sugar, corn syrup, 2 tablespoons of peanut butter, and vanilla extract. Mix well.
Add cereal to the bowl and mix well to coat.
Press the mixture into a greased 8-inch baking pan.
Bake for 5 minutes.
Let the cereal mixture cool completely.
In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate and remaining peanut butter together on medium power for 3-4 minutes, stirring every minute until smooth.
Spread the melted chocolate mixture evenly over the cooled cereal layer.
Refrigerate the bars until the chocolate is set.
Cut the bars into desired sizes and store them in the refrigerator.

name: Mary Lynn's Salsa
ingredients: 40 yellow peppers (3 cups yellow + 1 cup green)
instructions: Combine all ingredients.
Boil and stir often.
Reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 1 hour.

name: Almond Graham Squares
instructions: Preheat oven (temperature not specified in the image).
Line a 9x13 inch pan with greased parchment paper (or grease the pan directly based on the ingredient list).
Press graham cracker crumbs into the bottom of the prepared pan.
Pour melted butter over the graham cracker crust.
Sprinkle brown sugar over the melted butter.
Sprinkle slivered almonds over the brown sugar.
Broil (oven temperature and broiling time not specified in the image).
Watch closely and turn off broiler when topping is golden brown.
Let cool completely before cutting into squares.

name: Almond Graham Squares
instructions: Preheat oven (temperature not specified in the image).
Line a 9x13 inch pan with greased parchment paper (or grease the pan directly based on the ingredient list).
Press graham cracker crumbs into the bottom of the prepared pan.
Pour melted butter over the graham cracker crust.
Sprinkle brown sugar over the melted butter.
Sprinkle slivered almonds over the brown sugar.
Broil (oven temperature and broiling time not specified in the image).
Watch closely and turn off broiler when topping is golden brown.
Let cool completely before cutting into squares.

name: Cranberry Oatmeal Cookies
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, wheat bran, and baking powder.
In a separate bowl, cream together the margarine, sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract until light and fluffy.
Add the egg to the wet ingredients and beat until well combined.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Stir in the oats and dried cranberries.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly browned.
Let the cookies cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Baked Apple Crisp (with oatmeal)
instructions: Arrange apples in a 9x6 inch baking dish.
Combine flour, rolled oats, brown sugar, and butter.
Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the apples.
Add chopped nuts on top (optional).
Bake at 350°F for 35-40 minutes, or until apples are tender.

name: Sugar Pie
instructions: Cook the sugars, milk or cream, maple extract, and butter together until slightly thickened.
Pour the mixture into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 400°F for 10 minutes, then reduce heat to 350°F and bake for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the filling is set.

name: Sweet Marie Bars
instructions: Heat the peanut butter, brown sugar, corn syrup, and butter in a pot on medium-high heat until it reaches a boil.
Remove from heat and add Rice Krispies and peanuts.
Spread the mixture onto a pan.
Cover with a bag of milk chocolate chips.
Broil for 1 minute.
Spread the melted chocolate over the mixture.
Harden at room temperature before cutting, or if refrigerated, allow 10 minutes before cutting.

name: Naomi's Hawaiian Dreams
ingredients: 1 ½ cups cake and pastry flour
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees Celsius).
Cream ½ cup butter and 4⅔ cups brown sugar together.
Beat in vanilla extract.
Mix in 1 ½ cups cake and pastry flour and pinch of salt.
Press the mixture into the bottom of an ungreased 9-inch square baking pan.
Bake for 15 minutes, or until golden brown. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack.
Spread 1 can (undrained) crushed pineapple over the cooled crust.
In a separate bowl, cream together ¼ cup butter or margarine and ¾ cup sugar.
Beat in 1 egg.
Stir in 1 cup shredded coconut.
Spread the coconut mixture over the pineapple.
Cut into squares and store in refrigerator.

name: Jill's Oatmeal Cookies
instructions: Cream together shortening, brown sugar, and egg until light and fluffy.
Add remaining ingredients and blend well.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet.
Press flat with a fork.
Bake at 350°F for 5-6 minutes.

name: Blueberry Lemon Muffins
ingredients: ½ cup melted butter or margarine
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and lemon rind.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, melted butter or margarine, and milk.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
Gently fold in the blueberries.
Divide the batter evenly among greased muffin cups.
Bake at 375°F for 15-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
For the topping, combine 1/4 cup melted butter or margarine, 2 teaspoons lemon juice, and 1/2 teaspoon sugar.
Pour the topping over the tops of the muffins while they are still warm.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1 (300g) package of Hershey's milk chocolate chips
instructions: Beat together the melted butter, brown sugar, eggs, and hot water until well combined.
Stir in the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake at 350-375°F for 6-8 minutes, or until golden brown.

name: Milk Chocolate Granola Bars
ingredients: 1 package (300g) Hershey's milk chocolate chips, melted
instructions: Combine crushed corn flakes with melted Hershey's milk chocolate chips, vegetable oil, chopped peanuts, and raisins.
Mix well.
Spread evenly into the bottom of a greased 8x8 inch square pan.
Chill for about 1 hour.
Cut into bars.
Store leftover bars in the refrigerator.

name: Sweet and Sour Meatballs
instructions: Combine ground beef, bread crumbs, beaten egg, salt, and pepper. Form into small balls.
Brown the meatballs in a pan. Set aside.
In the same pan, sauté the sliced onion.
Combine ketchup, water, brown sugar, vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce in the pan.
Bring the sauce to a boil.
Add the browned meatballs to the sauce.
Bake in a slow oven (250-300°F) for 1 hour.

name: Le Gatean de Grand-maman
instructions: Beat eggs and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add shortening alternately with flour, beating well after each addition.
Add vanilla extract.
Bake at 375°F for 5 minutes, then reduce temperature to 350°F.
Bake for an additional 35 minutes, or until sides of the cake pull away from the pan.

name: Taco Dip
ingredients: 1 package taco seasoning (reserve some for sprinkling on top)
instructions: Beat together the cottage cheese and cream cheese.
Stir in the taco seasoning (reserve some for sprinkling on top).
Spread the mixture on a serving platter.
Sprinkle with chopped tomato, green pepper, onion, and shredded cheese.
Serve with taco chips or nacho chips.

name: Magic Cookie Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (325°F for glass dish).
Melt margarine. Sprinkle crumbs over margarine in a 9x13 inch pan (3.5L). Mix together and press down firmly.
Pour Eagle Brand over crumbs.
Top with remaining ingredients.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until lightly browned. Cool before cutting.

name: Scotch Shortbread
instructions: Mix ingredients well.
Bake in a slow oven (225-250°F) until golden brown (about 40 minutes at 250°F).

name: Brownie Miniatures
instructions: In a saucepan over low heat, melt sugar, butter, and chocolate, stirring until chocolate is just melted.
Remove from heat and let cool for 1 minute.
Blend in vanilla and egg. Gently fold in flour until just blended.
Spoon into tiny petit-four baking cups.
Bake at 350°F for 8-10 minutes, or until set.
Remove from oven. Set a Rosebud on top of each and let cool.

name: Chipits Chocolate Caramel Almond Bars
instructions: Mix the flour, oats, brown sugar, baking soda, and melted butter well. Reserve 1 cup of this mixture and press the remainder into a greased 9x13 inch pan.
Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes, or until lightly browned.
Sprinkle the Chipits Chocolate Caramels and slivered almonds over the crust.
Mix the butterscotch syrup with ⅓ cup of flour and pour over the crust.
Sprinkle with the reserved mixture.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden.

name: Yorkshire Pudding
instructions: Beat all ingredients well.
Fat must be hot. Use ¼ cup of fat and heat until bubbly. Pour batter into fat.
Place in a 425°F oven for 15 minutes. Then reduce heat to 375°F for 30 minutes.

name: Sponge Cake
instructions: Cream together sugar and butter.
Add eggs.
Stir in flour.
Bake at 375°F for ½ hour.

name: English Trifle
ingredients: Bird's Custard (approx. 2 cups prepared, use ½ here for each layer)
instructions: Break apart half of the sponge cake and crumble it into a large glass bowl. Spread raspberry jam on top.
Sprinkle with approximately ½ cup of Sherry.
Pour cold Bird's Custard over the top (follow directions on can to make approximately 2 cups; use half of the prepared custard here).
Break apart the second half of the cake and place it over the cold custard.
Spread raspberry jam on top of the cake.
Sprinkle with more Sherry.
Put the second half of the custard on top.
Finally, spread with whipped cream and candy sprinkles.

name: English Trifle
ingredients: Bird's Custard (approx. 2 cups prepared, use ½ here for each layer)
instructions: Break apart half of the sponge cake and crumble it into a large glass bowl. Spread raspberry jam on top.
Sprinkle with approximately ½ cup of Sherry.
Pour cold Bird's Custard over the top (follow directions on can to make approximately 2 cups; use half of the prepared custard here).
Break apart the second half of the cake and place it over the cold custard.
Spread raspberry jam on top of the cake.
Sprinkle with more Sherry.
Put the second half of the custard on top.
Finally, spread with whipped cream and candy sprinkles.

name: Apple Torte
instructions: Beat eggs until light, gradually add sugar and beat until fluffy.
Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt and add to the above mixture.
Add chopped apples and chopped walnuts and blend well.
Pour into greased 8" cake pan and bake in 325°F oven for 30-35 minutes. Serve warm.

name: Chocolate Pecan Bars
instructions: Combine crust ingredients until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Press into greased 15x10 inch (39cm x 27cm) pan.
Bake at 350°F for 15 minutes.
Heat chocolate and corn syrup over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in remaining filling ingredients.
Pour filling over hot crust and spread evenly.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes, until filling is firm around edges but still soft in the middle.
Cool completely.
Pour melted drizzle over top. Cool.

name: Chocolate Chow Mein Clusters
ingredients: 1 can or package of chow mein noodles
instructions: Melt chocolate and butterscotch chips.
Add peanuts and noodles and mix well.
Drop by spoonfuls onto a cookie sheet covered with wax paper. Chill.

name: Turtle Bars
ingredients: ½ cup light brown sugar (for topping)
instructions: Mix flour, packed light brown sugar, and ⅔ cup butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press into an ungreased 13x9 inch baking pan.
Sprinkle chopped pecans evenly over mixture.
For topping: Cook ½ cup light brown sugar and ⅔ cup butter in small saucepan stirring constantly until mixture starts to boil.
Boil for 1 minute. Pour over pecans.
Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes, until firm.
Immediately sprinkle with milk chocolate chips and spread to cover. Cool on wire rack. Cut into squares.

name: Crab and Spinach Quiche
ingredients: ½ pkg (10 oz) frozen chopped spinach, thawed
instructions: Cook pie shell.
Thaw crabmeat.
Beat eggs.
Add milk, mustard, nutmeg, salt, and sherry. Mix well.
Drain spinach. Add spinach, cheese, and crabmeat to egg mixture. Stir well.
Pour into prepared pastry shell.
Bake in oven at 350°F for 1 ½ hours.
Cook on 60 (Bake) in microwave for 30-35 minutes. Rotate dial ¼ turn every 10 minutes.

name: Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Remove stems from mushrooms and dice them.
Brown the diced stems.
Blend browned stems with sausages, bread crumbs, and shredded mozzarella cheese.
Stuff the mushroom caps with the mixture.
Heat in oven at 350°F for 10 minutes, or until cheese bubbles.

name: Crab Dip
instructions: Mix all ingredients together.
Heat at 350°F until it bubbles (15 min).
Serve with a plain cracker (Crispers).

name: Date Squares
instructions: Mix base ingredients (Brown Sugar, Butter, Oats, Flour, Soda, Salt).
Cook date filling ingredients (dates, sugar, water) until soft, then cool.
Spread half of the oat mixture in a pan, then spread the date filling. Put the remaining half of the oat mixture on top.
Bake for 20 minutes at 350°F.

name: Laura's Butter Tarts
instructions: Mix 1 cup brown sugar, water, and butter. Boil for 3 minutes. Cool a little.
Mix 2 well beaten eggs, ¾ cup brown sugar and vanilla and add to the first mixture.
Add raisins and walnuts.
Pour into pastry shells.
Bake at 425°F for 10 minutes.
Turn to 350°F. Bake 15 minutes.

name: Ottawa Valley Best Butter Tarts
instructions: Melt butter and sugar over low heat. Remove from heat and add raisins; let cool.
In a medium bowl, beat together eggs, cream, and vanilla.
Stir in nuts, then the butter-sugar mixture.
Spoon butter mixture into tart shells, filling ⅔ full.
Bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes, until pastry is golden and filling puffed up but firm. Remove from pans and cool on racks.

name: Shortbread
instructions: Cream butter and half of the sugar.
Work in flour and cornstarch, then the last of the sugar.
Knead well and press into a round shape.
Bake for 30-40 minutes in a slow oven (300-325°F).

name: Sponge Cake
instructions: Cream sugar and butter.
Add eggs.
Stir in flour after adding eggs.
Bake at 375°F for approximately ½ hour.

name: Chicken & Broccoli Braid
ingredients: ½ cup chopped red bell pepper
2 pkgs (8 oz each) refrigerated crescent rolls
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Mix first 8 ingredients together.
Unroll crescent dough and place on rectangular baking sheet, longest sides of dough along length of pan. Repeat with remaining package of rolls to seal perforations in dough.
Cut dough 4 cm apart, 8 cm deep, leaving 15 cm in the center for filling.
Spread filling in center. Cross over strips like a braid, twisting each strip one turn.
Brush egg white on top and sprinkle with almonds.
Bake 25 minutes, or until brown.

name: Coleslaw
instructions: Shred cabbage. You could shred finely with a sharp knife, or use a grater or food processor.
Sprinkle with remaining ingredients. Toss lightly to coat cabbage well with dressing. Serve immediately.

name: Spareribs
ingredients: A few bits of celery (for boiling)
instructions: Boil ribs for 1 ½ hours with just enough water to cover. Save water. Boil with 2 medium onions and a few bits of celery.
Mix sauce ingredients together and put in a pan. Cook until thickened.
Pour sauce over ribs and bake in a 325°F oven for 1 hour. Turn ribs once.

name: Cocktail Sauce for Shrimp or Oysters
instructions: Mix together.

name: Peanut Butter Crisps
ingredients: ½ cup corn syrup or honey
4 cups Rice Krispies OR 1 cup Rice Krispies and 3 cups Corn Flakes
instructions: Heat sugar and corn syrup/honey until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat.
Stir in peanut butter and vanilla.
Pour hot syrup over cereal and stir gently.
Pat into a greased 8x8 pan. Cut into squares.

name: Meat Loaf
instructions: Mix and bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.

name: Chicken Mushroom Casserole
ingredients: Cooked rice (enough for ½ filled casserole)
1 can boneless chicken (flakes of chicken) or leftover chicken
instructions: In a casserole, place 1 layer of cooked rice, spread with some soup (straight from can). Put some mushrooms and chicken bits on top.
Add another layer of rice and repeat. Continue until dish is almost filled.
Sprinkle almonds on top.
Bake in a 350° oven for 1 ½ hours or until warmed through and bubbly on top.

name: Rice Krispie Squares
instructions: Melt margarine. Add marshmallows, stir until melted & well blended. Remove from heat.
Stir in vanilla. Add cereal & stir until coated.
Press into lightly buttered 9x13" pan.

name: Cherry Square
ingredients: 1 pkg. Dream Whip (prepared as directed on pkg)
instructions: Make a graham wafer crust as directed on the graham wafer box. (See notes for alternative crust)
Beat together prepared Dream Whip, 1 tsp vanilla, icing sugar, and cream cheese. Spread over the graham wafer mixture in the dish.
Top with cherry pie filling and sprinkle a bit of graham wafer mixture over the top. Chill overnight to set.

name: Brownie Treats
ingredients: 4 c. Rice Krispies crushed to 2 cups
instructions: Combine crushed cereal, coconut, chocolate chips & nuts. Add condensed milk & mix until combined.
Pour into greased 8" pan & bake 350°F for 40 min.

name: Brownie Treats
ingredients: 4 c. Rice Krispies crushed to 2 cups
instructions: Combine crushed cereal, coconut, chocolate chips & nuts. Add condensed milk & mix until combined.
Pour into greased 8" pan & bake 350°F for 40 min.

name: Seed Cake
instructions: Cream sugar and butter together. Beat in eggs one at a time.
Sift flour and baking powder. Add vanilla to milk.
Add dry ingredients alternately with liquid. Stir caraway seeds into mixture and pour into greased 9x5" loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool 10 minutes in pan then turn out of pan onto wire rack to cool completely.

name: Chocolate Zucchini Loaf
ingredients: 1 tsp each of baking soda and cinnamon
¾ c. fat-free egg substitute or 3 whole eggs
instructions: Combine dry ingredients.
Mix wet ingredients into dry ingredients, stirring just until moistened.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Bake at 350°F for 50 minutes.

name: Chocolate Butter Icing
ingredients: ¼ c. hot water, or coffee
instructions: Melt unsweetened chocolate and butter.
Remove from heat.
Add hot water or coffee and salt. Add icing sugar gradually.
Add vanilla.

name: Zucchini Loaf
instructions: Beat eggs until light. Add sugar and oil.
Stir together flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and cinnamon. Add to egg mixture, beating until blended.
Mix in vanilla, zucchini, and nuts.
Bake 350°F for 1 hour.

name: Coconut Squares
ingredients: ½ c. butter or margarine (for crust)
instructions: Cut butter into flour and brown sugar until it resembles coarse crumbs. Press into 9x9" pan. Bake 400°F 10 min.
Mix brown sugar, flour & baking powder.
Mix in eggs, beating well after each addition. Add other ingredients and put over shortbread crust. Bake 20 min. at 350°F.
Cut into squares.

name: Baker's "Best" Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Beat butter, sugars, vanilla & eggs until light & fluffy.
Mix in flour, baking soda, & salt by hand until well blended. Stir in chips & nuts.
Drop onto ungreased pan. Bake 10-12 min or until lightly browned. Choose lower time & watch carefully.

name: Pizza Dough (thick)
instructions: Combine warm water, sugar, and yeast. Let sit for 5-10 minutes.
Add oil and salt.
Add flour. Stir and knead until dough is not sticky. Let rise until double.
Roll out to size of pizza pan. Place pizza dressings on top.
If a thicker crust is desired, let sit for awhile (10-15 min).
Bake at 350-400°F for 20-25 min.

name: Tabouleh
instructions: Soak bulgur in boiling water.
Add salt, lemon juice, crushed garlic, mint, and olive oil.
Shortly before serving, add tomato, green onions, and parsley.

name: "One Hundred Cookies"
instructions: Cream white sugar, brown sugar, margarine, oil, egg, and vanilla.
Combine flour, soda, and cream of tartar.
Combine both mixtures.
Add Rice Krispies, coconut, and oatmeal.
Mix. Roll into balls & flatten with a fork. (Just drop onto pan.)
Bake at 350°F approx. 8 min.

name: Pumpkin Pie
instructions: Beat eggs lightly, add pumpkin, sugar, salt and spices. Stir until well combined. Blend in milk. Pour into pie shells.
Bake at 425°F (230°C) for 15 min. Then reduce oven temperature to 350°F (180°C) and continue baking 30-40 min. until inserted toothpick comes out clean. Cool.

name: Classic Quiche
instructions: Partially bake pie shell for 10 min (375°F) in oven.
In frying pan cook bacon until crisp, crumble, drain & set aside. Keep 1 tbsp drippings.
Cook onion until soft.
Combine onion, bacon, cheese, flour and salt. Spread cheese mixture into pie shell.
Beat eggs and evaporated milk and pour over cheese mixture.
Bake 25 min or until filling is slightly puffed and knife inserted near middle comes out clean. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

name: Coconut Cake
instructions: Mix all cake ingredients together in one bowl.
Bake in 8x8" pan at 350°F for 30-35 min.
For the icing: Boil milk, butter, and brown sugar for 3 min. Remove from heat. Add icing sugar. Beat with fork until it is spreading consistency.

name: Macaroni and Cheese
instructions: Cook macaroni. Set aside.
Melt butter and mix with flour. Stir 3-4 min. Whisk in milk and stir until just thickened. Add salt, then cheese. Remove from heat and mix with macaroni.
For the Topping: Mix butter with bread crumbs. Put on top of casserole.
Heat at 325°F for ½ hr.

name: Pumpkin Muffins
instructions: Beat eggs, sugar, oil & pumpkin thoroughly.
Sift dry ingredients; add to creamed mixture.
Bake at 350°F for 15-20 minutes.

name: Gingerbread
instructions: Cream butter and sugar. Add egg beaten, molasses, then dry ingredients together. Add hot water last. Beat until smooth.
Bake in 9x13 pan at 325-350° oven for 35 min.

name: Butter Icing
instructions: Cream butter.
Blend icing sugar and milk alternately.
Beat until smooth and of good spreading consistency. Add more icing sugar or milk if necessary.

name: Spicy Pumpkin Loaf
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F. Line 9x5" loaf pan with waxed paper.
Sift together dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, cloves, ginger).
Beat eggs until light. Add sugar, corn syrup, corn oil & pumpkin and beat until combined.

Make a well in the dry ingredients and add liquid ingredients all at once and stir until combined. Add raisins and walnuts. Pour batter into loaf pan and bake approx. 80 min. or until cake tester comes out clean. (2 smaller loaves cook 60 min.)
For the Simple Glaze: Combine corn syrup and water. Bring to a boil. Spread glaze over quick breads or fruit cakes. When dry, glaze is clear and shiny.

name: Pineapple Upside Down Cake
instructions: Melt butter in bottom of 9x9" pan. Stir in brown sugar and arrange pineapple slices with cherries.
Mix flour, baking powder and salt.
Cream butter and sugar. Add egg and beat well. Add milk & vanilla. Mix flour mixture to first mixture.
Pour over sugar and pineapple in pan. Bake 350° for 40-45 min. Turn out from pan.

name: English Rice Pudding
instructions: In an 8" casserole combine milk, rice, sugar, butter & nutmeg.
Bake in 300°F oven for 2 hours. Stir approx. 3 times until thickened & rice is tender.

name: Rhubarb Cake
instructions: Mix flour and soda and set aside.
In a large bowl, cream brown sugar and margarine.
Beat in egg.
Beat in flour and milk alternately. Stir in vanilla and rhubarb.
Put into greased 9" x 13" pan. Sprinkle with white sugar and cinnamon.
Bake at 325°F until a toothpick comes out clean. About 40 min.

name: Rhubarb Squares
instructions: Mix and press crust ingredients into buttered 9x13" pan. Bake at 350°F until light brown.
Mix filling ingredients.
Pour filling over baked crust and bake at 350°F for 45 min. or until cooked.

name: Rhubarb Dessert
instructions: Mix base ingredients and press into a 9x13" pan. Bake at 350°F for 10 minutes.
Mix filling ingredients and pour out over base. Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
For the meringue: Beat egg whites, add sugar and vanilla. Bake at 350°F for 10-15 minutes or until brown.

name: Rhubarb Pecan Muffins
instructions: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt and nuts.
In another bowl combine egg, oil, orange peel, and orange juice.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients and stir just until moistened.
Stir in rhubarb. Spoon into lightly greased muffin tins or cups.
Bake at 375°F for 25-30 min.

name: Bannock
instructions: Mix about with enough water to stick. Pat into round pan and cook until a bit brown. 350°F ½ hr.

name: Lisa's Salad
ingredients: Red and yellow pepper (½ c. of each)
instructions: Mix together all ingredients.

name: Chocolate Oatmeal Squares
instructions: Mix and bring margarine, sugar, cocoa and milk to a full boil in a medium sized pan.
Remove from heat & add rolled oats, coconut, chopped walnuts. Mix.
Put into a greased 8"x8" pan. Chill in refrigerator.

name: Saucepan Kisses
instructions: Combine sugar, milk, butter & salt in a saucepan. Bring to a boil stirring constantly. Boil for 5 min. Remove from heat and stir in other ingredients. Drop on wax paper. Cool.

name: Butterscotch Squares
instructions: Melt butter and stir in brown sugar, egg and vanilla until smooth. Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Spread mixture evenly in lightly greased 8" square baking pan. Bake at 350°F for 20-25 min or until golden.

name: Chocolate Hut Brownies
instructions: Melt Crisco and chocolate together.
Blend sugar and eggs and stir them into the melted chocolate mixture.
Beat in the combined dry ingredients.
Stir in nuts and vanilla extract.
Pour batter into a 9-inch square pan, greased with Crisco.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Cut into squares while warm.

name: Scotch Eggs
instructions: Boil the eggs until they are hard-boiled.
Set the eggs aside in cold water. Then, shell the eggs.
Coat each egg with sausage meat.
Dip the sausage-coated egg in egg, then roll it in breadcrumbs mixed with a bit of parsley.
Fry the egg in hot fat in a deep fryer until it's brown. The recommended frying time is 4 minutes at 170 degrees Fahrenheit.
Serve the Scotch Eggs hot or cold.
Cut each egg in half before serving.
Serve the Scotch Eggs on a piece of fried bread or with cucumber slices (optional).
Garnish with parsley (optional).
You can also serve the Scotch Eggs with salsa or tomato relish (optional).

name: Lemon Bars
instructions: Mix graham wafer crumbs, melted margarine, and enough all-purpose flour to make a stiff dough. (Reserve ⅓ of the mixture for topping)
Spread the remaining dough in an 8x8 inch greased pan.
Mix sweetened condensed milk and lemon juice. Pour over crumb mixture.
Sprinkle remaining crumbs over top.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.

name: Ichiban Salad
ingredients: Broccoli slaw (shredded broccoli, carrots, red cabbage)
Bunch of thinly sliced green onions
1 package Oriental flavored Ichiban noodles or
1 package Mr. Noodles single serving dry soup mix
Seasoning from the noodle soup mix
instructions: Mix the first four ingredients (broccoli slaw, green onions, toasted almonds, and sunflower seeds) in a bowl.
Just before serving, crush the noodles or noodle soup mix and add it to the salad.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the vinegar, vegetable oil, sugar, and seasoning from the noodle soup mix to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.

name: Sugar Cookies
instructions: Cream sugar and margarine together until light and fluffy.
Add eggs and vanilla extract, then mix well.
Combine baking powder, flour, and salt in a separate bowl. Then gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Preheat oven to 350°F (325°F for best results according to the image).
Lightly flour a surface and roll out the dough to about 1/8 to 1/4 inch thickness.
Cut out shapes using cookie cutters.
Bake on a greased baking sheet for 8-10 minutes.
Decorate with colored icing (optional).

name: Raspberry Squares
instructions: Mix butter and flour together until crumbly. Pat the mixture into an 8x8 inch pan.
Bake at 325°F for 20 minutes.
Spread raspberry jam over the baked crust.
Beat egg whites until stiff. Then, gradually add sugar, cornstarch, and baking powder.
Pour the egg white mixture over the raspberry jam.
Cover the top with crushed nuts (optional - not mentioned in the recipe but görünen in German means appear/be visible)
Bake at 325°F for an additional 20 minutes.

name: Toffee Almond Treats
instructions: Combine crust ingredients (flour, oatmeal, baking soda, and brown sugar) in a 13x9 inch baking pan. Mix until crumbly.
Bake at 350°F (180°C) for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine butter and corn syrup in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the mixture boils. Remove from heat and stir in water and brown sugar.
Pour the toffee mixture over the baked crust and spread evenly.
Bake at 350°F (180°C) for an additional 15-28 minutes, or until golden brown.
Cool and cut into triangles.
Store in the refrigerator.

name: Apple Chip Coffee Cake
instructions: In a small bowl, beat the egg. Then stir in the oil and sugar.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Stir in the chopped apples.
Spread the batter into an 8x8 inch pan.
In a separate bowl, make the crumb topping by mixing the flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. Then cut in the butter using a pastry cutter or fork until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle the crumb topping over the batter.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

name: Sour Cream Coffee Cake
instructions: Combine walnuts, cinnamon and ¾ cup of sugar. Grease a 10 tube pan.
Beat butter or margarine until light and fluffy. Then, cream in 1 ½ cups of sugar.
Add eggs one at a time, then stir in sour cream and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients alternately with the sour cream, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients.
Spread half of the batter in the greased pan. Sprinkle with half of the nut mixture.
Pour the remaining batter over the nut mixture and sprinkle with the remaining nut mixture.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 60-65 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool completely before cutting and serving.

name: Brocolli Salad
ingredients: ½ cup seedless green grapes, halved
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the broccoli florets, raisins, grapes, green onion, cauliflower, and celery.
In a separate bowl, mix together mayonnaise, vinegar, and sugar to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Serve immediately. (Optional: Mandarin oranges and sunflower seeds can be added before serving)

name: Maple Pecan Squares
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix flour, butter, brown sugar, and salt together in a bowl until crumbly. Press the mixture into the bottom of an 8-inch square pan.
Bake the crust for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, maple syrup, brown sugar, and vanilla extract.
Stir in the pecans.
Pour the maple pecan mixture over the baked crust.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool and cut into squares.

name: Blueberry Muffins
instructions: Mix flour, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.
In a separate bowl, cream together sugar and egg.
Add milk and melted butter to the wet ingredients and mix well.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Fold in the blueberries.
Fill muffin cups ¾ full of batter.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Optional: To make the lemon butter topping, whisk together melted butter, lemon juice, and icing sugar in a small bowl. Drizzle over the muffins after they cool slightly.

name: Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins
instructions: In a large bowl, stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, cream together sugar and melted butter.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the mashed bananas and milk.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Fill muffin cups ¾ full of batter.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

name: Strawberry Salad
ingredients: ½ pint fresh strawberries, washed and sliced
Fresh herbs (text in the image is unclear, but likely basil or mint)
instructions: Combine all ingredients except feta cheese and walnuts in a large bowl.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Add feta cheese and walnuts just before serving.

name: Lemon Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, cream together flour, powdered sugar, and salt.
Cut in the butter using a pastry cutter or fork until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press the mixture into the bottom of an ungreased 9x13 inch pan.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, sugar, lemon zest, and lemon juice.
Pour the lemon custard over the baked crust.
Bake for an additional 25-30 minutes, or until the filling is set.
Cool completely and cut into squares. Sprinkle with icing sugar (optional).

name: Best Ever Banana Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cream butter and sugar together in a large bowl until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the mashed bananas.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, salt, and nutmeg.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients alternately with the mashed bananas, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients.
Fold in the blueberries (if using).
Pour batter into two greased loaf pans.
Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Yellow Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease and flour 4 8-inch round pans or a 9x13 inch pan.
Cream together the softened butter and sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Alternately add the dry ingredients and milk to the wet ingredients, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Beat until just combined.
Pour batter into prepared pans.
Bake for 20-25 minutes for the 8-inch round pans, or 30-35 minutes for the 9x13 inch pan, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Leave cakes in pans for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Chocolate Care
ingredients: 9' pans (possibly a typo, likely 9x13 inch pans)
instructions: Stir together flour, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Then, add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Alternately add the flour mixture and milk to the wet ingredients, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Stir in vanilla extract.
Pour batter into a greased 9x13 inch pan (or two 9-inch round pans according to the image).

In a separate bowl, make the crumb topping by mixing flour, baking soda, salt, brown sugar, and vanilla extract. Then cut in the chopped nuts using a pastry cutter or fork until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle the crumb topping over the batter.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 35-40 minutes for a 9x13 inch pan, or 30-35 minutes for 9-inch round pans, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cream together the softened butter and peanut butter in a large bowl until light and fluffy.
Add the granulated sugar and brown sugar and beat until well combined.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Mix until just combined.
Shape the dough into 1-inch balls.
Roll the balls in granulated sugar (optional).
Place the balls on baking sheets lined with parchment paper, leaving space between the cookies for spreading.
Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
Let cool on the baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Banana Brend
ingredients: Fold in blueberries (without blueberries according to image)
Pour batter into two greased pans
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) according to text in image, but image shows 500°F (260°C).
Cream butter and sugar together in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the mashed bananas.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Mix until just combined (do not overmix).
Optional: Fold in the blueberries.
Pour batter into two greased loaf pans.
Bake at 500°F (260°C) for 50 minutes - 1 hour, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Pizza Doge
ingredients: Fresh parsley (for garnish according to image)
instructions: Sauté onion in oil until golden.
Add water, soup, parsley, and oregano. Bring to a simmer and stir frequently.
Boil hot dogs and then put them in a prepared 13 x 9 inch pan.
Pour sauce over hot dogs in the pan.
Top with shredded cheese.
Broil for 1 minute until cheese is melted.
Garnish with fresh parsley (optional).

name: Hamburger Soup
ingredients: 28 oz (can) consommé (900g contains 1002g of tomato soup)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large pot.
Simmer, covered, for 2 hours.
Serve.

name: Meat Cabbage Rolls
ingredients: Water (amount not specified in the image)
Milk (1-2 cups according to the image)
instructions: Boil cabbage leaves until partially cooked. Cool slightly.
Combine meat, salt, pepper, and rice. Mix well.
Put 1-2 tablespoons of mixture on each cabbage leaf. Roll up and fasten with a toothpick.
Heat shortening in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Brown the rolls on all sides.
Add brown sugar and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 1 hour.
Add milk and simmer for an additional 30 minutes, or until cabbage is tender and cooked through.
Serve hot.

name: Lace Cookies
ingredients: Baking powder (not specified in the image)
instructions: Rub butter into eggs and beat well.
Add dry ingredients (rolled oats, brown sugar, flour, baking powder, and salt) and mix well.
Drop by spoonful onto parchment paper lined baking sheets.
Bake at 300°F (150°C) for 5 minutes or until golden brown. Watch carefully as they burn easily.

name: Apple Spice Muffins
ingredients: 2 ½ cup all-purpose flour (whole wheat flour can be substituted if desired)
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, salt, and chopped apple.
In a separate bowl, combine the egg, sugar, and melted butter. Stir into the dry ingredients until just moistened.
Spoon batter into greased muffin tins.
Combine brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a small bowl. Sprinkle over muffin tops.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

name: Green Bean Salad with Feta and Walnuts
ingredients: 1 tbsp. minced green onion or shallot
2 tbsp. seasoned rice vinegar or white wine vinegar
instructions: Blanch the green beans in boiling water for 3-4 minutes, or until tender-crisp. Drain and cool completely.
In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, Dijon mustard, salt, and freshly ground pepper.
Add the green beans, feta cheese, walnuts, and red pepper to the bowl and toss to coat evenly.
Serve immediately.

name: Dessert Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven according to image (temperature not specified).
Press dough onto a pizza pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) until light brown (approx. 10 minutes). Let cool.
Cover the crust with lemon curd.
Top with desired fruits (raspberries, strawberries, blueberries, kiwi, and peaches).

name: Maple Syrup Baked Beans
ingredients: 2 lbs. dry white or navy beans
1 ½ c. maple syrup or molasses
instructions: Rinse the beans in a large pot. Add water and bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes, then drain and transfer the beans to a slow cooker.
Add 12 cups of water to the slow cooker and cover. Cook on low for 10-12 hours, or until the beans are tender.
In a separate bowl, combine the onion, ketchup, maple syrup or molasses, garlic, brown sugar, dry mustard, salt, and pepper.
Stir the mixture into the beans in the slow cooker. Cook on low for an additional 4-6 hours, or on high for 2-3 hours.

name: Mix and Match Ice Cream Dessert
ingredients: ½ c. butter or margarine, melted
Chocolate sundae sauce (or your choice of sauce)
instructions: Combine flour, rolled oats, and chopped brown sugar in a bowl.
Stir in melted butter or margarine until crumbly.
Spread the mixture in a greased 9x13 pan.
Cook at 400°F (200°C) until golden brown, approximately 20-25 minutes.
Let the crust cool completely.
Stir together the softened ice cream and spread it over the cooled crust.
Drizzle with chocolate sundae sauce (or your choice of sauce) and freeze until solid, cover recommended according to the image.

name: All-Bran Buds Muffins
instructions: Stir together dry ingredients (flour, All-Bran Buds, baking powder, sugar, and salt) in a large bowl.
Combine vegetable oil, egg, and milk in a separate bowl and mix well.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix.
Optional: Fold in blueberries.
Pour batter into greased muffin liners.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for about 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

name: Easy Shortbread Cookies
instructions: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Beat butter and icing sugar with an electric mixer until light and creamy.
Beat in vanilla extract.
Gradually add flour and mix until well combined.
Roll dough onto a lightly floured surface to ½ inch thickness.
Cut out shapes with cookie cutters.
Place cookies on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake for 14-16 minutes, or until the bottoms are lightly browned.
Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack before serving.

name: Chipits Cherry Nut Bars
ingredients: I c. coarsely chopped nuts (for surface)
instructions: In a saucepan, melt margarine or butter.
Add sugar and vanilla extract to the saucepan and remove from heat.
Stir together flour, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix well.
Stir in semi-sweet chipits and chopped nuts (optional) to the mixture.
Spread the mixture in a greased 9x13x2 inch pan.
Sprinkle coarsely chopped nuts over the surface of the mixture.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 35-40 minutes, or until golden brown. Let cool completely before cutting into bars.

name: Banana Oat Muffins
instructions: Combine first 6 ingredients (oats, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt) in a large bowl and mix well.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg, mashed bananas, and melted butter until smooth.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir just until moistened.
Fold in chopped nuts (optional).
Fill muffin cups and bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

name: Bannock Marie Seymour (1981)
instructions: For every 2 cups of flour, add 1 tablespoon of lard.
Add water to the mixture until sticky.
Flatten the dough in a pan (1 inch thick).
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 20-30 minutes.
**Note:** If making fry bread, do not add lard.

name: Sugarless Date Squares
instructions: **Filling:** Simmer and stir dates with hot water until thickened. Add 2 tsp orange juice and cool.
**Base:** Cut 1 ½ c flour into 1 c softened margarine until crumbly. Press into an 8x8 greased pan.
Sprinkle with a mixture of ½ tsp baking powder, ½ tsp baking soda, and ½ tsp salt.
Add 2 c quick-cooking oats and mix well.
Pour filling over oat mixture.
Sprinkle top with 3 tbsp concentrated orange juice.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 35-40 minutes, or until golden brown.

name: Butterscotch Blondies
instructions: Combine butter, eggs, and sugars (butter, ½ c. sugar, and brown sugar) in a bowl and mix until well-combined.
Add baking powder and mix.
Fold in butterscotch chips and Smarties (optional) to the batter.
Spread batter into a greased 9x9 inch pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown.
Let cool completely before cutting into squares.

name: Church Snack (December 2018)
instructions: This recipe is a list of ingredients for a party mix. No specific instructions are provided.

name: Oat Bags
instructions: Cut fabric into desired size for oat bag.
Fold the fabric lengthwise with right sides together.
Sew one end and one side of the fabric, leaving the top open.
Turn the bag right side out.
Sew the top of the bag closed.

name: Country Style Apple Yogurt Coffeecake
instructions: Cream together margarine, brown sugar, and white sugar. Add vanilla and eggs and beat until fluffy.
In another bowl, mix flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Add apples and raisins.
Add flour mixture to butter mixture and blend to moisten. Fold in plain yogurt.
Pour into a greased 9x13 pan.
In a small bowl mix brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and chopped nuts for the topping. Sprinkle over batter.
Bake at 325°F for 30-40 minutes.

name: Chocolate Spiders
instructions: Heat chocolate and butterscotch chips until melted.
Cool slightly. Add noodles, marshmallows, and peanuts, stirring until coated with the chocolate mixture.
Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper. Chill.
To give spiders eyes, decorate with small candies or butterscotch chips.

name: Skor Squares
instructions: Crush crackers within the package. Put into a bowl and mix with Skor chips.
Stir in condensed milk. Mix well to coat.
Press into a 9x9 inch pan and refrigerate until cool.
Cut and enjoy!

name: English Tea Cake
instructions: Split sponge cake in half.
Spread with raspberry jam. Put together and dust top with icing sugar.

name: BBQ Chicken
instructions: Cover thawed, skinless chicken with ketchup, molasses, and brown sugar. Bake.

name: Wilma's Dip
instructions: Mix together and serve with vegetables.

name: Pita Rolls (Appetizer)
instructions: Spread tortilla shells with a mixture of cream cheese, salad dressing, grated carrots, and grated broccoli.
Roll tortillas and cut into slices for a quick and easy snack.

name: Fruit Pizza
ingredients: 1 carton Cool Whip or made up Dream Whip (for topping)
instructions: Mix together crust ingredients and press into pizza pan.
Bake crust at 350°F for 8-10 min. Cool crust.
For the glaze: Cook sugar, orange juice, water, and cornstarch until thick and bubbly. Cool glaze.
Cream cream cheese. Spread cream cheese mixture over crust.
Top with topping mixture of strawberries, grapes, bananas, and kiwi. Drizzle glaze over fruit.

name: Mocha Icing
instructions: Mix butter and icing sugar.
Add cocoa, salt, and hot coffee.
Beat. Add vanilla or almond flavoring.

name: Lemon Icing
instructions: Mix icing sugar with lemon juice. Pour over cake while warm. Hardens.

name: Wild Wedges
instructions: Put tortilla into pan, top with ingredients, then place another tortilla on top. Brown, and cut into triangles.

name: Chocolate Butter Icing
instructions: Melt unsweetened chocolate and blend into creamed butter, or add cocoa in with icing sugar.

name: Lemon Butter Icing
instructions: Omit milk and blend icing sugar into butter alternately with lemon juice and grated lemon rind. Add milk if necessary.

name: Coffee Butter Icing
instructions: Prepare as butter icing but add instant coffee dissolved into boiled water. Blend into creamed butter.

name: Carrot Casserole
instructions: Sauté onions in butter. Add cheese whiz to melt. Stir in soup. Pour over carrots placed into a greased casserole dish. Crumble rite crackers on top.
Put in 350° F oven (Cover), approx. ½ hr. until it bubbles.
